page.title: 08THE LOCAL ROADS.
page.content: Two tarmacadam roads run through this section, rising from 625ft. to 1159ft. Mount Road runs west with stone built owner occupied and council housing on either side. After 1 mile it becomes a moorland road meeting the A62 at Standedge. Binn Road commences at the same 4 spur roundabout and goes south rising to 875ft. This road trails off to a footpath which leads onto the moorland. Housing is found on either side of the road and are again stone built properties. There are 3 cul-de-sacs of mill houses on one side of this road and a small road giving access to the mill on the other side. Access via a flight of 162 stone steps cut into the hillside descends to the base of Butterley Reservoir.
